intro: Tetrataenium mianguaqi, commonly known as the Greenland sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant with small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tundra and coastal areas. Tetrataenium mianguaqi plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small arctic organisms.
